title: Duplicate Trait Objects Warnings

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

body:
The following code emits two warnings about deprecated trait objects without `dyn` ```rust #[derive(Clone, Copy)] struct Double { x: Iterator } ```
Error 

warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated
 --> src/lib.rs:3:8
  |
3 |     x: Iterator
  |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use `dyn`: `dyn Iterator`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(bare_trait_objects)]` on by default

warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated
 --> src/lib.rs:3:8
  |
3 |     x: Iterator
  |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use `dyn`: `dyn Iterator`

error[E0204]: the trait `Copy` may not be implemented for this type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:17
  |
1 | #[derive(Clone, Copy)]
  |                 ^^^^
2 | struct Double {
3 |     x: Iterator
  |     ----------------------- this field does not implement `Copy`
  |
  = note: this error originates in a derive macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error: aborting due to previous error; 2 warnings emitted
`x` can be any trait object without a `dyn`, the important thing is that **both** `Clone` and `Copy` exist, and both can't be implemented (normally for size issues). I was unable to reproduce using one `derive` and one `impl` on a trait, or two `impl`s. It seems to be caused specifically by multiple errors in the derive macros. ### Meta This happens for both debug and release configurations, on all current versions of the compiler. Tested versions: Stable 1.50.0 (cb75ad5db 2021-02-10) Beta 1.51.0-beta.1 (a5a775e3f 2021-02-11) Nightly 1.52.0-nightly (e9920ef77 2021-02-11) [Playground Link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=9317d361f084fde85a5bbd13ce1d7b17)
